body:
## Steps to Reproduce

The application  fails to run from Android Studio on iOS simulator. The output with verbose logging enabled is:
```
[  +30 ms] executing: which pod
[   +8 ms] Warning: CocoaPods not installed. Skipping pod install.
             CocoaPods is used to retrieve the iOS and macOS platform side's plugin code that responds to your plugin usage on the Dart side.
             Without CocoaPods, plugins will not work on iOS or macOS.
             For more info, see https://flutter.dev/platform-plugins
           To install see https://guides.cocoapods.org/using/getting-started.html#installation for instructions.

[   +4 ms] CocoaPods not installed or not in valid state.
[        ] Error launching application on iPhone 12 Pro.
[   +4 ms] 
           #0      throwToolExit (package:flutter_tools/src/base/common.dart:10:3)
           #1      RunCommand.runCommand (package:flutter_tools/src/commands/run.dart:571:9)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #2      FlutterCommand.run.<anonymous closure> (package:flutter_tools/src/runner/flutter_command.dart:1125:27)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #3      AppContext.run.<anonymous closure> (package:flutter_tools/src/base/context.dart:150:19)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #4      CommandRunner.runCommand (package:args/command_runner.dart:209:13)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #5      FlutterCommandRunner.runCommand.<anonymous closure> (package:flutter_tools/src/runner/flutter_command_runner.dart:288:9)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #6      AppContext.run.<anonymous closure> (package:flutter_tools/src/base/context.dart:150:19)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #7      FlutterCommandRunner.runCommand (package:flutter_tools/src/runner/flutter_command_runner.dart:236:5)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #8      run.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure> (package:flutter_tools/runner.dart:62:9)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #9      AppContext.run.<anonymous closure> (package:flutter_tools/src/base/context.dart:150:19)
           <asynchronous suspension>
           #10     main (package:flutter_tools/executable.dart:92:3)
           <asynchronous suspension>
``` 

*Please not that running it from command line works without problem.*

[âœ“] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 31.0.0)

[âœ“] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS

[âœ“] Chrome - develop for the web

[âœ“] Android Studio (version 2020.3)

      ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter

comment_data.body:
This is caused by your PATH being incorrect in the IDE. You may need to reboot to get it set correctly. The IDE uses the PATH defined by the login environment, not a local shell path.

Note that the instructions at https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install/macos#update-your-path are incorrect (and I filed a ticket to correct it). It states you have a choice of which script file to edit. You actually have to use the login script and that varies by which shell you use, so I can't tell you exactly which file to edit.

title: Running app from Android Studio on iOS Simulator/Device  gives back "CocoaPods not installed or not in valid state."
